definitions.definition: To cause something not to have been said ; to make it so that one never said something ( since this is physically impossible, usually in the subjunctive ).
examples: I wish I could unsay that.
There are some things I'd like to unsay ... to my boss... right before he decided to fire me.

secondary_definitions: To cause something not to have been said ; to make it so that one never said something ( since this is physically impossible, usually in the subjunctive ).
